metadata.case_name: Mahabir Mandal & Ors. v. State of Bihar

facts.text: Mahabir Mandal (58, homeopathic doctor), father of Dasrath Mandal (24, medical student); Kasim Ansari (30, compounder); Mahadeo Sah (60, servant); Kedar Nath Upadhya (28, taxi driver) tried before Additional Sessions Judge Monghyr.
Indira Devi (18, deceased), wife of Dasrath, daughter of Baijnath Mandal (PW 2); married at 13, stayed at father's house for 5 years due to dowry demand of Rs. 2500 by Mahabir.
Letter dated March 29, 1962 from Dasrath to Baijnath reminding promise of Rs. 2500 for medical college admission; Muragawan ceremony in April 1962, Indira went to husband's house.
In Bhadon 1962, Baijnath took Indira back home per Dasrath's letter; later Mahabir took her back; Mahabir alleged illicit intimacy with son Rajendra, sent her back to father's in Dec 1962.
May 1963: Tilak ceremony and marriage in Mahabir's family; Indira not invited; Baijnath brought her uninvited, left her there despite Mahabir's resentment.
June 7, 1963: Mahabir's letter to Baijnath complaining of fire set by Baijnath's instigation, threatening action if no settlement.
August 7, 1963: Mahabir met Bhai Lal Mandal (PW 18) in Calcutta, asked to take Indira back alleging illicit intimacy, threatened fatal injection; Bhai Lal's letter Aug 8, 1963 to Baijnath.
Indira died in Mahabir's house, Nayagaon, Jamalpur on night of Sept 17, 1963; Mahabir woke Mahadeo, Kasim, Gobind at 1:30-2 AM; Mahadeo brought taxi by Kedar Nath.

Dead body placed in taxi with cement bag of bricks in boot; Mahabir, Kasim front seat; Mahadeo, Gobind below back seat with body; taken to Kamarganj Ghat (21 miles), bag tied to waist, thrown in chest-deep Ganges water.
Returned to Jamalpur at 5 AM; Shiban Mandal (PW 8), Mushahru (PW 15) saw Mahabir, Dasrath morning Sept 18 near house.
Head Constable Suleman Khan (PW 6) heard rumors morning Sept 18, informed SI Kishori Lal (PW 2) at 11 AM; SI went to Mahabir's house, door closed; interrogated Kasim, Mahadeo.
Jagdish (PW 9) informed Baijnath of death ~8 AM; Baijnath lodged FIR Ex.18 at 2 PM Jamalpur PS.
3:30 PM Sept 18: SI found empty ampules of cocaine, homeopathic phial, distilled water ampules outside dispensary, seized; arrested Mahadeo, Kasim.
Sept 18 evening: ASI Birbhadra Singh with Mahadeo to Chandi Asthan, no body found.

Sept 19 ~5 AM: To Kamarganj Ghat per Mahadeo, body recovered with brick bag; inquest; PM by Dr. Hari Shanker Prasad (PW 21) 4:30 AM: greenish discolouration, abrasion left cheek, lungs congested, heart normal empty, viscera no poison.
Mahadeo confession Sept 21 before Magistrate B.M. Rastogi: helped dispose body.
Mahabir, Dasrath surrendered Sept 30, 1963; Dasrath absent from Darbhanga hostel Sept 14-19, 1963.

Mahabir's defense: Indira died natural sudden convulsion ~8 PM Sept 17 after stomach trouble, influenza; informed relatives; disposed body per custom with Jitan, Thakur, Mahadeo ~10 PM, returned midnight.
Dasrath alibi: in Darbhanga at Ram Lakhan Bhagat's house attending typhoid patient.
Kasim: denial.
Mahadeo: Awakened after 8 PM death; prepared per Mahabir; rainy, only one taxi, he, Mahabir, Thakur took body; no Gobind.
Sessions Court: Acquitted Kedar; convicted Mahabir, Dasrath 302/34, 120B, 201 (life +4 yrs RI concurrent); Mahadeo, Kasim 120B, 201 (3 yrs RI); possibility of morphine not ruled out.
High Court upheld convictions, appeal dismissed Jan 31, 1969.

legal_issues.text: Whether prosecution established homicidal death of Indira by Mahabir, and involvement of others in murder (302/34), conspiracy (120B), disposal of body (201).
Whether death was natural or due to poisoning/injection, given no poison detected and PM findings.
Presence and complicity of Dasrath on night of occurrence.
Role of Kasim and Mahadeo in disposal, knowledge of murder.

petitioner_arguments.text: No evidence Mahabir caused death; death natural, not homicidal.
No cogent evidence Dasrath present at Jamalpur on night of occurrence.
Kasim not proved to take part in removal of body.

respondent_arguments.text: Circumstantial evidence proves Mahabir's guilt: motive, threat, hasty secret disposal.
Dasrath present, absent from hostel, seen morning after.

court_reasoning.text: Mahabir had motive (aversion, suspicion of intimacy, dowry, resentment); proved by Baijnath, letters; threat to Bhai Lal Aug 1963 of fatal injection.
Sudden death in presence; no intimation to father; hasty secret disposal at night to distant ghat (21 miles vs nearer 5-6 miles), bricks to sink body; absconded till Sept 30.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Conduct indicates guilty conscience, not natural death.

court_reasoning.text: PM: congested lungs, empty heart; consistent with poisoning/respiratory failure/asphyxia; no poison detected does not rule out as poisons may not be detectable post-delay/submersion.
No reliable evidence Dasrath present: PW8,15 unreliable (delay, enmity); Mahadeo confession excludes others; hostel absence not proof of presence at crime.
No reliable evidence Kasim involved in disposal; statements to police inadmissible u/s 162 CrPC.
Mahadeo admitted helping disposal in surreptitious manner; must have known not natural.

holdings.text: Death homicidal by Mahabir; chain of circumstances consistent only with guilt.
No direct proof needed for poisoning manner if circumstances prove; negative viscera not conclusive.
No proof Dasrath present or conspired.
Mahadeo guilty u/s 201 IPC for knowing disposal to screen offender.

precedents_cited.case_name: Anant Chintaman Lagu v. State of Bombay
precedents_cited.relevance: Circumstantial evidence sufficient for poisoning murder even without isolating poison.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of Madhya Pradesh v. Ramkrishna Ganpatrao Limsey
precedents_cited.relevance: No parallel facts; not for speculation.
S.162 CrPC bars accused statements to police.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Penal Code
statutes_cited.relevance: Murder with common intention, conspiracy, causing disappearance of evidence.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Criminal Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Examination of accused; inadmissibility of statements to police.

statutes_cited.name: Indian Evidence Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Confessions in custody; discovery; dying declarations; contradiction.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed for Dasrath and Kasim: acquitted of all charges. Conviction of Mahabir under ss.302, 201 IPC and Mahadeo under s.201 IPC maintained; convictions under s.120B set aside for all.
outcome.relief_granted: Acquittal for Dasrath, Kasim; sentences maintained for Mahabir (life +4 yrs concurrent), Mahadeo (3 yrs RI).

key_quotes.text: "The circumstances of the present case taken in their entirety clearly point to the conclusion that the death of Indira was not natural but was due to foul-play."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "A case of murder by administration of poison is almost always one of secrecy... the guilt of the accused must, in all cases, be demonstrated by the isolation of the poison, though... circumstantial evidence... can be decisive."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Relies on precedent to uphold conviction without poison detection.

key_quotes.text: "In the end, Doctor Babu told us that not he would take his action very soon... He has such an injection... she will remain sleeping... On the same pretext he will give her that injection... she will depart from my house for ever."
key_quotes.speaker: bhai_lal
